meanings.sent1: The officer ticketed the car parked in the no-parking zone.
meanings.sent2: She ticketed the passengers before they boarded the train.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ticketed all the nuts in the garden for fun.
meanings.sent4: The teacher ticketed the students who were late to class as a reminder to be punctual.
meanings.sent5: The parking attendant ticketed every car without a valid permit.

meanings.sent1: The ticketed passengers waited in line to board the plane.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved knowing she was ticketed for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The ticketed guests enjoyed the exclusive access to the event.
meanings.sent4: The ticketed attendees eagerly awaited the start of the show.
meanings.sent5: The ticketed travelers had their boarding passes ready for inspection.

meanings.sent1: The inspector ticketed the items for clearance at the airport.
meanings.sent2: She ticketed the products with the correct prices for the sale.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully ticketed the dishes with imaginary prices for fun.
meanings.sent4: The librarian ticketed the borrowed books with return dates.
meanings.sent5: The gardener ticketed the plants for identification in the botanical garden.
